page.title: 13THE AIRPORT, IPSWICH.
page.content: The airport is a civil airport, covering a large part of South-east Ipswich. The grass runway limits the size of aircraft to pleasure craft. Opened in 1935 by H.Balfour, it was originally designed in preparation for the threat of war.Today, it's use is domimated by flying clubs, one of the largest being "The Ipswich Flying School".Here people can learn the art of flying solo or parachuting. The future of the airport is always uncertain.Speculation includes it's change of use to an out of town Hyper- market,expansion as a regional airport or for industrial land. Today the shabby buildings are also used for squash courts and bars.
